page.title: 06CHURCHES IN COMBE MARTIN
page.content: There are five churches in the village the oldest being the{Parish {Church of St.Peter ad Vincula(St.Peter {in Chains)},built originally in the late 13th century,with 18th century additions.The burial ground surrounds the church. The{Bapist Church},likewise,has its own burial ground.Women's Organisations in both churches are active.The{Methodist Church}has a Youth Organisation as well.The{Roman {Catholic Church}which is a modern building,is served by a priest from Lynton.The existence of a{Russian {Orthodox Church} and priest in the area is quite unusual.Services are held in part of a private house and also in a formerly disused chapel at Pilton,Barnstaple.
